title: Kim Jong Un’s Sister Blasts Top South Korean Diplomat Over Pandemic Remark
sub_head: Kim Yo Jong threatened Seoul’s foreign minister after she questioned the North’s account of Covid-19 cases
body:
SEOUL—North Korea, quiet on foreign relations for months, vilified a top Seoul official over her recent remarks about Pyongyang’s pandemic response and deployed an increasingly familiar mouthpiece, Kim Yo Jong, sister of the regime’s leader.
Ms. Kim, a close confidante of Kim Jong Un, took aim on Wednesday at South Korea’s foreign minister, Kang Kyung-wha, who said at a security forum last week that Pyongyang’s oft-repeated claim of zero confirmed Covid-19 cases was “hard to believe.”
In apparent response to the comments, Ms. Kim said, “We will never forget her words and she might have to pay dearly for it.”
Pyongyang’s return to public rebukes, a hallmark of the Kim regime’s foreign-policy tactics, encapsulated much of North Korea’s behavior this year, when it has been consumed by domestic affairs and has directed much of its anger toward its southern neighbor.
South Korea’s foreign ministry didn’t comment on Ms. Kim’s statement.
